values.alignmentText: NZ's Auckland/Wellington market offers steady .NET work in government and enterprise. Local demand is niche, so remote contracts and grants matter.
New Zealand 2D Environmental Artist pay often ~20% below global medians; remote options and grants help offset costs in NZ.
NZ offers design/arts continuing education via polytechnics and universities; expect sporadic workshops and online courses for 2D environmental art.

NZ studios primarily use English; basic Māori knowledge is appreciated in some teams, but English remains the default for 2D Environmental Artist work.

NZ's game dev scene is anchored by Auckland studios like Grinding Gear Games and RocketWerkz, offering steady roles and training.
New Zealand's secular culture is strong. Atheism draws little attention in daily life and schools.
New Zealand's independent courts and open media sustain a robust democracy; backsliding risk is very low.
New Zealand banks offer modern, easy online accounts and instant domestic transfers; cross-border fees persist, so keep a US fintech for moves.
New Zealand’s coastal cities offer excellent, lifeguarded beaches within easy reach; water is cool and UV is strong, so sun protection and wetsuits stay essential.
New Zealand's Auckland/Wellington hubs keep Trey engaged; outside metros, board-game groups exist but require planning.

NZ cancer rates align with global norms; universal healthcare supports widespread screening and early detection.
New Zealand prisons maintain strong oversight with restorative programs; humane conditions and fair labor practices support families seeking stability.
NZ offers subsidies and 20 Hours ECE, but Auckland waitlists mean Sarah and Trey must proactively build neighbor/family care networks.
9: NZ cities are very kid-friendly—safe streets, abundant parks, and universal healthcare; strong schools support our family.

NZ's 20 Hours ECE mainly covers 3-4 year-olds; visa families still face limited subsidies, keeping private childcare costs high for your 1-year-old.
NZ offers a broad hobby scene: weekend tramping, bouldering, indie games, and easy-to-join rugby culture for casual fans.

New Zealand's health-conscious lifestyle is common. Universal healthcare and family-friendly policies align with Trey and Sarah's needs.

Autumn in New Zealand is mild overall; North Island sits around 14–20 °C with occasional rain, South Island cooler fronts.

New Zealand offers universal healthcare for residents. Temporary visa holders face charges and eligibility limits, so support is mixed.

New Zealand's relaxed-but-polite vibe. A neat, practical look works in work and social settings.

New Zealand's scenery is abundant and accessible from Auckland and Wellington, with beaches, forests, and mountains along trails for family outings.

Abundant nature within an hour in NZ cities; great walks, DOC campsites, and safe, family-friendly parks nearby; easy access and mild climate.

In New Zealand, outside Auckland, commutes stay short and shops close earlier, giving Sarah the slower rhythm she wants for family time.

New Zealand's low corruption and strong institutions support stable governance for your family's future.

New Zealand generally respects personal space; in crowds people avoid touching unless invited, with hugs reserved for close friends.
New Zealand's maritime climate yields many mild months; occasional rain and cool spells require light planning, but most months are outdoor-friendly.
New Zealand's MMP with coalition governance offers transparent, resilient democracy and strong rule of law, aligning with the family's progressive values.
Polyamory is largely accepted in New Zealand, especially in Auckland and Wellington. Public services may misunderstand, but private networks are supportive.
NZ's licensed ECE centers are widespread in Auckland, but top areas still run waitlists. Subsidies help 3-4 year-olds; 0-2 years vary by provider.
Private schools exist in New Zealand with tuition around NZ$15k-25k; quality varies. Public schools are the preferred option for strong academics and bilingual exposure.
Processed foods are common in NZ, but strong farmers markets and fresh produce help balance choices for your family.

values.key: Product Marketing Manager (Games): Continuing Education Availability
values.alignmentText: NZ offers regular game dev meetups in Auckland/Wellington and university courses; many online options via NZGDA keep PMM skills current.

Winter daylight in New Zealand is shorter but manageable. Regular outdoor breaks and occasional light therapy keep energy up.

values.key: Spacious Housing Benchmark (2k sq ft Rent)
values.alignmentText: NZ markets (Auckland/Wellington) have 2k sq ft rentals in suburbs. Expect location/finish trade-offs and possible bidding in peak season.

New Zealand's pluralist, rights-respecting politics with coalition governance supports open debate and social investment.

values.key: View of Them by Neighboring Countries
values.alignmentText: New Zealand is viewed by Australia and Pacific neighbors as stable and eco-conscious; moving there aligns with a welcoming, family-friendly region.
NZ has Skilled Migrant, Entrepreneur, and Investor routes with online EOIs; quotas exist but criteria are clear.
NZ cities have walkable pockets and parks for families. Plan routes to avoid busy arterials and use transit where available.
New Zealand values skilled migrants, including US applicants; clear visa pathways and settlement support, with city communities in Auckland and Wellington.
New Zealand's vibrant indie tech and game dev scene, with grants and visas, invites your entrepreneurial family. Māori culture and landscapes enrich daily life.
Winter in New Zealand is generally mild. Coastal areas run about 8-14 °C, with occasional frosts inland and heating costs stay manageable.
In New Zealand, standard workweeks are around 37–38 hours with flexibility. This aligns with our family’s need for work-life balance and remote options.
New Zealand workplaces prize balance with flexible hours and remote options. Sarah can protect evenings for family dinners, though launches may bring crunch.
NZ offers strong workers' rights: robust health & safety, paid leave, and accessible recourse. Union coverage exists but isn't universal.
